Posts.Content: Hi Mags I had my last chemo on 11 March and now have a good covering of hair. My 16 year old daughter thinks I should shave it all off again as she thinks I look better without it. I'm not sure if I should be flattered or offended ha ha. My hair started coming out in clumps about a week after my 1st treatment and I had a neighbour come and use the clippers on it. It's quite an ordeal while it's happening but once it's gone, it's actually quite a relief. I didn't even bother wearing my wig. I quite enjoyed seeing people's expressions when I was walking about bald as an egg. If you can't use the clippers, maybe just cut it as short as possible with scissors. Eventually I went into the bath, put my head under the water and just gave it a good rub and the last of it fell out. Hope you get on ok and best wishes to your mum
Posts.Title: It's happening- hair loss

Posts.Content: Hi Von I finished chemo back in March and have a head of rather strange hair. My passport expired about 3 weeks ago and I said I wasn't renewing it just now because I didn't want to be stuck with a picture of me with weird hair for 10 years. Having said that, how often do you look at it? Have you got a wig? You could have the picture taken wearing it. I don't think you'd have a problem with passport control as people change their hair styles all the time. It's my 50th birthday early next year so I'm going to have to go ahead do it as we want to go away. x
Posts.Title: here's a weird question

Posts.Content: Seems to be the way it goes ladies. Mine coming back there too and I had to shave my legs the other day for the first time since December. Too bad we can't choose. Yes to head, eyebrows and eyelashes. No thanks to the rest of it. Save us a fortune in waxing and razors. Ah well think of the points on your advantage cards lol x
Posts.Title: Nice appointments!

Posts.Content: I managed to keep my eyebrows but they're blonde too. Always used to get them tinted but I didn't do it during chemo. I've just been colouring them with some stuff from benefit. i was looking in the mirror the other day though and the sun was coming in the window. OMG, the hairs on my face have gone into overdrive. If I don't do something about it, all I'll need is a red suit and black boots and I'm sorted for some temp work in December! Ho ho ho
Posts.Title: Nice appointments!

Posts.Content: Wow Ali. Think you need to go and buy a lottery ticket. You have to be due some luck. I had my last heart scan 2 weeks ago and was told my heart function had reduced. Was told to still go for next Herceptin anyway as it was still within 'normal' range and they'll see what the results of the next one are. Good thing is apparently it's not permanent and the heart recovers as soon as Herceptin stops. Happy birthday btw. Maggie, I ditched tamoxifen after 3 weeks as I couldn't deal with the side effects. x
Posts.Title: HAPPY BIRTHDAY

Posts.Content: Do you remember the thing about the bone scan and being told I wasn't in enough pain? I mentioned it to one of the  bcns and she arranged one for me. I'm going this Friday. That's another trip into the city but I'm fine with that as my back pain is getting worse so at least then I'll know if there's anything going on. Fingers crossed it's nothing suspicious. Anyone else had one? Think there might be more waiting around involved than with the heart scan but I'm not sure. x
Posts.Title: HAPPY BIRTHDAY

Posts.Content: Sex on legs x
Posts.Title: HAPPY BIRTHDAY

Posts.Content: Hi Ali im doing the 5:2 as well. 2 days a week I only eat 500 calories. It's hard but you know you can eat normally the next day so I can manage it. You shouldn't do 2 days together. I normally do Monday and Thursday. ive lost about a stone since April. Mind you 5lbs of that were my boobs after mx lol x
Posts.Title: Weight loss after chemo radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi Maggie I was down in the dumps sometimes but mainly I was like a woman possessed. I didn't recognise myself. I was vile to everyone closest to me but mainly my mum which I felt terrible about as she's been by my side throughout this whole thing. My daughter called me 'angry mum' and said she was glad when I decided to stop taking the stuff. I couldn't have carried on with it any longer. x
Posts.Title: HAPPY BIRTHDAY

Posts.Content: Hi folks I've been lifting carpets this morning (like I have nothing better to do). Using cutters to prise up staples and gave myself a bit scratch on my hand on the side I had nodes removed. My bcn said to contact the GP for antibiotics if you injure yourself no matter how minor. Is that really necessary? I don't want to look like Mrs Neurotic lol. x
Posts.Title: Cuts and scratches

Posts.Content: Thanks Maggie That makes sense. My own fault. I should've had gloves on. x
Posts.Title: Cuts and scratches

Posts.Content: Thanks for that Crystal I wouldn't even have given it a thought if that nurse hadn't made such an issue of it. Sounded like overkill to me. I gave it a good wash straight away. I'm sure it'll be fine. Good excuse for me to leave the rest of the work to my OH. x
Posts.Title: Cuts and scratches

Posts.Content: Hi Ali im doing the 5:2 as well. 2 days a week I only eat 500 calories. It's hard but you know you can eat normally the next day so I can manage it. You shouldn't do 2 days together. I normally do Monday and Thursday. ive lost about a stone since April. Mind you 5lbs of that were my boobs after mx lol x
Posts.Title: Weight loss after chemo radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi i had WLE last October, 6 x fec-t and then bilateral mastectomy. And am now having herceptin.  I asked my surgeon about 'all clear' and he said they don't ever say that to anyone but that there was no active cancer cells in the tissue they removed. I take that as being in remission which will do me. i suppose they just don't want to commit themselves.
Posts.Title: when is all clear?

Posts.Content: Hi Denise Yes, I agree with you there. Heard that song for the 1st time a couple of days ago and my ears pricked up straight away. I don't normally pay that much attention to lyrics so I wasn't quite sure at first  I'd heard properly. Maybe we're all just a bit more sensitive to it. Glad your foot is better and you're finished Herceptin. I've just had number 10. xx
Posts.Title: It's even getting into songs now ....

Posts.Content: Lol, yes she is a bit. Reminds me of these celebs who have a baby and think they're the first women to do it. She'll be writing a book next. I wish her well but I'm not watching or reading any of her sermons x
Posts.Title: Anybody else been Victoria Derbyshired????????

Posts.Content: She is a journalist and broadcaster. Has a daily show on BBC2. I have to say she irritated me too. Yes we know it's doable. There are thousands of us who have done or are doing it right now. What choice is there but to do it? Everyone's experience is different too. I'm sure she thinks she's doing the right thing and raising awareness but personally I wish she'd just go and get on with it in private. That's just my opinion though x
Posts.Title: Anybody else been Victoria Derbyshired????????

Posts.Content: I also agree ladies. My grandmother was a stalwart of the British Women's Temperance Association. She never touched a drop of alcohol her whole life. My mum will take a glass of wine on special occasions and I'm almost teetotal just because I don't like the taste of booze and we've all had bc. No genetic connection. i think it's mostly just bad luck. So what makes you happy and everything in moderation. I'm watching my diet and exercising just to feel better. By the way for all you sufferers of hot flushes. I'm doing the 5:2 diet and I've noticed on my low cal days I have far less flushes than on the other days. luv x
Posts.Title: Measures to prevent breast cancer recurrence

Posts.Content: Hi Frances I have 3 amoena bras size 38C. I was a 36 but amoena come up a bit small I think. They are very good though. I haven't worn my prostheses at all 3 are brand new. What size do you wear normally?
Posts.Title: Mastectomy Bras

Posts.Content: I also agree ladies. My grandmother was a stalwart of the British Women's Temperance Association. She never touched a drop of alcohol her whole life. My mum will take a glass of wine on special occasions and I'm almost teetotal just because I don't like the taste of booze and we've all had bc. No genetic connection. i think it's mostly just bad luck. So what makes you happy and everything in moderation. I'm watching my diet and exercising just to feel better. By the way for all you sufferers of hot flushes. I'm doing the 5:2 diet and I've noticed on my low cal days I have far less flushes than on the other days. luv x
Posts.Title: Measures to prevent breast cancer recurrence

Posts.Content: Hi mumra im sure that was Friday and just so happened to be my low cal day. I've been quite naughty this weekend and noticed I've had a few more again and woke up a lot last night with them. Same again today. I've got another 500 cal day again tomorrow so will report back.  Lol Carol that's funny xx
Posts.Title: Measures to prevent breast cancer recurrence

Posts.Content: Hi mumra im sure that was Friday and just so happened to be my low cal day. I've been quite naughty this weekend and noticed I've had a few more again and woke up a lot last night with them. Same again today. I've got another 500 cal day again tomorrow so will report back.  Lol Carol that's funny xx
Posts.Title: Measures to prevent breast cancer recurrence

Posts.Content: Great news. So pleased for you! x
Posts.Title: Fantastic News!

Posts.Content: Hi Maggie May I know what you mean. Your imagination runs away with you at times. Are you on any medications? I take gabapentin before going to bed and I'm always a bit spaced and dizzy in the mornings. It wears off though once I've eaten and drunk something. If you have it all the time, it could be something else totally unrelated to your treatment. My hubby had something similar last year and it was to do with his inner ear. Nothing serious and soon sorted. Did the doc not suggest anything for it? x
Posts.Title: Vertigo after treatment

Posts.Content: Hi Weemaw I'm 2 months past chemo and my finger nails are a mess. Covered in ridges and seem to be sort of chalky so I can scrape bits off them. I thought they'd just grow out and come back normal. It didn't occur to me they might come off altogether eek!! Sorry I can't help with your query tho. x
Posts.Title: nails....

Posts.Content: Thanks for the tip Maggie May. I've just been and bought some of that. Dr Organics is great. I've been using their deodorant and manuka honey moisturiser's been good on the skin around my mastectomy scars. x
Posts.Title: nails....

Posts.Content: Hi mrs d i was advised to get some of the bra tops without the fastener. Asda does them for about £5 and I took the pads out of them. They're good because you can step into them and pull them up. Matalan does them too and I got some from one of the pound shops but their sizing was hit or miss. I was 36DD and bought the large from asda. x
Posts.Title: Bra advice please.

Posts.Content: I've got 3 horizontal ridges on each finger nail. One for each session of docetaxyl apparently according to one of the alternative therapist I've seen in oncology.. Weird, but I'm sure they'll grow out eventually. x
Posts.Title: nails....

Posts.Content: This is my hair 8 months post chemo. It has a life of it's own. It used to be blonde and quite straight. If I don't blow dry it and stick it down with wax, I look like Rory McGrath. I went into the hairdresser the other week and they said not to have it cut as it will just make it curlier. I'm sure I heard the giggles as I left. x
Posts.Title: Does anyone have curly chemo hair ?

Posts.Content: Hiya Tamoxifen is the only drug they can give to pre menopausal women. There are several of the aromatase inhibitors which are given to post menopausal women but they can also be given tamoxifen. Don't ask me though how they decide which one to prescribe. Luv x
Posts.Title: anastrozole versus tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Hi Shaz I know how you feel. I had bilateral mx on April 10. I didn't have recon but had scar tissue build up along my ribs. It felt like I was wearing a bra 2 sizes too small. I couldn't get comfy in bed as I couldn't lie on either side. I was getting desperate as I can't sleep on my back so hardly slept at all. I've no advice other than to go with what the physio is telling you. It will work. I had to massage myself which was fine as it was at the front. I've noticed a huge difference over the last couple of weeks and the scar tissue has softened to the point I can hardly feel it. Keep going with the exercises. All the best xx
Posts.Title: Scar tissue problems

Posts.Content: Hopefully you'll be ok to go ahead angie. youll get these heart scans about every 16 weeks while on the herceptin. I think I've had 3 now. You get an injection when you arrive. Wait half and hour and then get another one before having the scan. Mine always take exactly 7 minutes. My local hospital doesn't have a gamma camera so I have to travel into Edinburgh for it so it's about 4 hours altogether out of the house. I've just got my letter in for my next one. Luv x
Posts.Title: Taxotere side effects info please

Posts.Content: I'm with you Nina. I found tax much harder too. Breezed through FEC but the bone pain with tax was bad. I also had 5 days on I.V antibiotics in hospital after. I had an allergic reaction to the 2nd. I wouldn't like to do it again that's for sure. it seems to be if you have a hard time with FEC, then the tax is easier and vice versa. x
Posts.Title: Taxotere side effects info please

Posts.Content: Hi Angie Sorry, I wasn't trying to worry you. I just think forewarned is forearmed. I wish someone had told me what I might expect. I didn't join the forum until after my treatment was over. My unit was cagey about side effects and also warned me off any painkillers so I spent hours lying in the bath trying to ease the leg and back pain. Mr T didn't like me and got the boxing gloves on but it's not like that for everyone. Check with your unit about painkillers and keep an eye on your temperature. You will get through it and come out a stronger person. Best wishes and a big hug x
Posts.Title: Taxotere side effects info please

Posts.Content: Hi Sara My bcn suggested this as an option for me when I stopped taking tamoxifen. She made an appointment with the oncologist so we could discuss it but when I went for the appt, it was a new oncologist who decided I was post menopausal (even though my blood test showed otherwise) but suggested zoladex injections. I didn't want the injections either so the decision was made to wait and see if my periods came back. If so, I'll be advised to have my ovaries out and they can then give me one of the drugs they prescribe for post menopausal ladies. No doubt if I see my original oncologist, this subject will be raised again. I got the impression my case had not been discussed with the new doctor and he had no idea why I was there. As far as I'm aware, the procedure itself is quite straightforward and normally done by keyhole and as day surgery. x x
Posts.Title: OVARY REMOVAL ER+ BC

Posts.Content: Hi Angie Please don't allow yourself to be bullied. Take as long as you think you need. I've just returned to work after 10 months off. You cant be forced to do anything. You're now covered bt the equality act as a cancer diagnosis means you're classed as having a disability. Go to CAB is you have to or your HR dept should be aware. x
Posts.Title: Unsympathetic manager

Posts.Content: That's a coincidence Maggie May. I noticed a bit of a rash on my arm this morning. I'm coming up to my 3rd Herceptin. Could be nothing but I'll keep an eye on it. x
Posts.Title: enjoy bank holiday ♡♡·

Posts.Content: It's actually been quite pleasant up here north of the border. Been out tidying up my front garden before the weather changes as the grey clouds are gathering. At least I've achieved something today. I can put my feet up feeling pleased with myself. Got prosthesis fitting tomorrow. New boobs which will probably sit in my drawer as I've got used to going flat. It'll be nice to have the option though depending on what I'm wearing. Have a nice weekend everyone. x
Posts.Title: enjoy bank holiday ♡♡·

Posts.Content: Hi cristobel Sorry you've found yourself here. I'm a couple of months past chemo now but remember how scary it feels at the start. There's an active July Chemo Club thread with loads of advice and support from ladies going through it at the moment. Feel free to ask anything. There will always be someone happy to help. X
Posts.Title: Starting out......

Posts.Content: Hi again Kipper I know exactly where you're coming from. I've been battling with this decision for weeks. I wouldn't try to convince you either way. You have to just make a decision and be comfortable with it which is what I've done today. I saw my GP who didn't argue with me and agreed that quality of life is more important. I won't be taking any more tamoxifen. I've got an appointment with my bcn tomorrow and I'll tell her then. No doubt it won't go down too well. I hope you reach a decision you're happy with. x
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen advice needed

Posts.Content: Hi Kipper i can't give you advice on what to do. The Drs will tell you what they think you should do and that's what they're paid to do but they're not the ones who have to live with the side effects of these things. ive been on tamoxifen for 3 weeks and I'm on the verge of quitting. There's no way I can think about going back to work and getting my life back with no sleep, horrendous hot flushes and sweats and feeling like a basket case most of the time. I spoke to my Bcn who obviously couldn't agree that I should stop but did say at the end of the day it's about quality of life. i think you have to do what's right for you. Yes there's a risk it could come back but there's a risk of that even if you take it. ive got to see my GP tomorrow and will see what he says then I'll make a decision. Good luck with whatever you decide to do. x
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen advice needed

Posts.Content: Congratulations and celebrations to the new Neddys xx
Posts.Title: Another Neddy passes the finish post!

Posts.Content: If you're anywhere near a Dobbies garden centre, they have them there too x
Posts.Title: Adult colouring books

Posts.Content: Hi  Its been just about a year now since I was diagnosed and never once did any of the professionals mention a stage to me. All I was ever told was it was grade 3. I worked out the stage for myself. Could it be its the grade they've been talking about? i even had a look at the little folder I got from my Bcn where they wrote all the info in and it's not in there either.   Best wishes x
Posts.Title: stage/ tiering system confusion

Posts.Content: Hey Judith We have 3 bcns and they're all brilliant. I also checked my mum's book and it wasn't in there either. I'm sure it's one of these things they don't bother to tell you as it's the grade that's more relevant as Julia says. It's easy to work out. I was 2A and my mum 2B. As far as I'm concerned that little book is a history book now. Nasty little sod is long gone and better not mess with me again lol!! xx
Posts.Title: stage/ tiering system confusion

Posts.Content: Hi there I was put on tamoxifen in April after my last surgery. I lasted 3 weeks on it and decided not to take it any more. I was like someone possessed on it. My family's lives were hell and so was mine. I though I was losing my mind and the hot flushes were horrific. I couldn't take any of the other drugs either as I was premenopausal at diagnosis. To be honest I don't think I'd have taken any of them anyway. There was some noises from my bcn about ovary removal but then I was told they were quite happy for me not to take anything as long as my periods don't come back. So far they haven't. They stopped during chemo. I'm happy with my decision and I'm not going to waste time worrying about what might happen. The questionable small benefit from the tamoxifen wasn't worth the misery as far as I am concerned. Good luck with whatever you decide x
Posts.Title: Hello can anyone help?

Posts.Content: Hi there I was put on tamoxifen in April after my last surgery. I lasted 3 weeks on it and decided not to take it any more. I was like someone possessed on it. My family's lives were hell and so was mine. I though I was losing my mind and the hot flushes were horrific. I couldn't take any of the other drugs either as I was premenopausal at diagnosis. To be honest I don't think I'd have taken any of them anyway. There was some noises from my bcn about ovary removal but then I was told they were quite happy for me not to take anything as long as my periods don't come back. So far they haven't. They stopped during chemo. I'm happy with my decision and I'm not going to waste time worrying about what might happen. The questionable small benefit from the tamoxifen wasn't worth the misery as far as I am concerned. Good luck with whatever you decide x
Posts.Title: Hello can anyone help?

Posts.Content: It sure is confusing. I had WLE first and then adjuvant chemo. Bilateral mx after that which was at my request. Glad to be here though a year down the line. Even with bits missing and mental hair. x
Posts.Title: Very confused tonight!

Posts.Content: Hi there I was very sick with my 1st FEC and when I told oncology, they gave me i.v anti sickness meds prior to the chemo and that made a huge difference. I wasn't sick at all after that and had no nausea. I didn't even have to take the oral ones they gave me. It would be worth asking about that I think. Good luck x
Posts.Title: That awful nausea!

Posts.Content: Hi folks I was pretty lucky with the nails. My toe nails aren't too pretty but once the ridges grew out, my finger nails are fine. Maggie, I have a picture stuck in my head of your hair now. See below. Mine looks like an old shag pile carpet and it can't make up it's mind what colour it is. It's so bad I'm considering Brave the Shave and see if it comes in better next time. Shame about that girl. I suppose I can't complain.x
Posts.Title: neddys/moaning cows club !!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Ed I had a bone scan recently as like you I was having back pain. I got a call a few days later from my Bcn to say all was fine. It was good to know the cancer hadn't gone into my bones but I sill don't know what is causing it so I'm constantly taking pain killers. I had no back trouble at all beforehand. fingers crossed yours will be fine too x
Posts.Title: Head working overtime

Posts.Content: Hi Pat It probably depends where you are but I was called in by my bcn and fitted by her for a bra. They were ordered and brought to me in the ward afterwards. I got 2 free. A couple of weeks later, I had to go for a prosthesis fitting and was given another one by them. They were amoena make and are very good but I had to get a 38 instead of 36 as they are quite small made. I had no swelling at all but have had trouble with scar tissue along my ribs so have never actually worn the bras and have chosen to go flat as I had bilateral. You could try asking your bcn for advice. Hope all goes well for you. Luv x
Posts.Title: Bra recommendation, post surgery

Posts.Content: Great news Mags Your mum can join the Neddy's club now! xx
Posts.Title: Good news! Mum got the all clear after surgery!

Posts.Content: Aw lazyla. Hope all goes ok for you. Please let us know xx
Posts.Title: Is it back?

Posts.Content: Lol Ali Ive had so many offers of donations you wouldn't believe it. I think I'll have more than enough of my own though. I'll find out next week. Could be a licence to eat cake. X
Posts.Title: Reconstruction advice and info please.....

Posts.Content: Hi Pmcd I had a bilateral mx back in April. I was offered immediate recon but turned it down as I was convinced I didn't want it. However, I'm not so sure now and am seeing a plastic surgeon next Wednesday for a consultation. I thought everyone with bc was entitled to recon if they want it. It doesn't have to look false. Your breast or plastic surgeon should be able to advise which type is best for you. My breast surgeon said he wouldn't give me implants as they wouldn't suit my frame and would look false. He did offer LD flap which is from the back but I don't really want that as it would be both sides for me. I have seen one though. A lady at a recon info session stripped off to let me see and it was amazing. It was identical to her other breast. I suppose it depends on how good the surgeon is too. The ps I'm seeing does diep and if I have recon at all, that will be the one I'll have. I don't think age is a factor. My mum was 70 at dx and she was offered it but turned it down. I'd ask for a referral so you can discuss it with the experts. You can always change your mind x
Posts.Title: Reconstruction advice and info please.....

Posts.Content: Awesome. Well done! x
Posts.Title: I've only gone and done it !!

Posts.Content: I've never had any either. x
Posts.Title: which diagnosis is right ?

Posts.Content: Hi Bungle There seems to be a lot of different opinions with seroma. Some people say it's best to leave it and it will sort itself out. I had seroma after mx and my bcn got me to go to her every week for it to be drained and said they would stop doing it once they were getting under 50ml. This happened after 6 weeks and it's been absolutely fine ever since. I never once got a infection either. Hope you get it sorted out. I know how uncomfortable it can be. x
Posts.Title: Seromas and the risk of infection

Posts.Content: Hi Jo You've come to the right place. I didn't find the forum until my treatment was almost over. I'm not going to say don't worry because of course you're going to. I hope they tell you that it's  nothing sinister and send you on your way. But, if the worst happens you will deal with it. We are all way stronger than we think. Make sure you take someone will you tomorrow if you can and come back and let us know how you get on. A big hug and good luck xx
Posts.Title: breast clinic tomorow im worried sick

Posts.Content: Hi Maggie Pretty sure its not chicken pox. I had that when I was about 3. These are definitely zits. I've got a lovely double one on my chin and a biggie on my forehead so I look like cyclops. I used to have a fringe which would have come in useful for coverage but my hair hasn't grown back enough yet so I'm raiding daughter's make up for concealer. She thinks its hilarious. One of the nurses in oncology thinks its hormones which is why I'm thinking my periods might come back. In a way I wish they would then I'd maybe get a break from the hot flushes. x
Posts.Title: Acne!

Posts.Content: Hi folks I'm 6 months post chemo and I'm suddenly getting acne spots. Not just on my face but in weird places like my stomach, torso and the insides of my arms. I even had one at the base of my thumb. Has anyone else experienced this? My skin was like a baby's during chemo. Clear as a bell and totally unlined. I'm guessing this might just be a result of the chemo drugs leaving my system and everything will settle down. I certainly hope so anyway. I'm spottier than my teenager. It feels like I'm going through menopause and puberty at the same time. Could it be my hormones kicking back in? Maybe my periods will start again and I'll grow a new pair of boobs lol!! xx
Posts.Title: Acne!

Posts.Content: Hee hee. What a gorgeous bunch we all are. I'm also in possession of some enviable facial fuzz. I'm just glad it's blonde or I'd be going out with a paper bag over my head. ive managed to lose a stone since May but got a way to go before I could be considered slim and I've no boobs at all. Having said all that, I couldn't give a monkeys. After all we've been through I think we're bloody amazing!! Xx
Posts.Title: Acne!

Posts.Content: Great news Jo. Happy for you!! xxxx
Posts.Title: breast clinic tomorow im worried sick

Posts.Content: Hi Smoothie Re periods. I had mine regularly throughout my 3 FEC but never had another one after that. Last one was in January. It's still a possibility they'll return as I was premenopausal when I started. Be careful what you wish for. If they stop then you'll probably get the symptoms of menopause i.e hot flushes which aren't fun either. Swings and roundabouts I guess. Hope you get on ok tomorrow. x
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: I know exactly what you mean Kathy. It feels like someone has suddenly put my life on fast forward. Between my hot flushes and grey hair (which I didn't have before),  I think I've aged about 10 years in the past 10 months. Oh well, at least I'm still here to moan about it lol. x
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Just as well we don't know what's in front of us kathy. Happy birthday anyway!! My next ones my 50th. Here's hoping it's better than my 49th. x
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed back in September 2014 with a (supposedly) 10mm grade 1 tumour. I had a lumpectomy and was supposed to then have a few sessions of radiotherapy. At my follow up appointment, this changed to 35mm, grade 3 and her2 positive. I've completed 18 weeks of chemo, had a bilateral mastectomy 12 days ago and have started Herceptin. I'm also beginning tamoxifen tomorrow. I had a follow up appointment today with the surgeon who told me there was no sign of any cancer in the tissue he removed and he doesn't need to see me again till September. I was delighted with the news but then fell apart when I got home after barely shedding a tear the whole time when having treatment. I also feel bad as although I wanted to give him a big hug, all I could do was smile politely and say thank you and I can't help feeling he must think me the most ungrateful person in the world. Am I just being a crazy woman??
Posts.Title: Good news!!

Posts.Content: Hi Maggie My BCN told me they offer a referral to the local authority sports centre for 12 weeks free membership. After that they'll give a reduced rate on a membership. There are also specialist exercise classes for cancer patients. I think they're run by MacMillan but I'm not sure. It would be worth asking your BCN what they can offer you. I intend taking everything they'll give me. I can't go back to work till I can fit back into my clothes!!
Posts.Title: exercise on prescription

Posts.Content: Many happy returns. Enjoy your day xx
Posts.Title: HAPPY BIRTHDAY !!!!!

Posts.Content: Thanks Daisyboo (and everyone else who replied) I'm glad I didn't too ha ha. Imagine how I'd be cringing this morning in the cold light of day. Only small downside today is that I begin the dreaded tamoxifen. I can't seem to find anyone who has anything good to say about it. If there's anyone out there who's not had any problems with it, it would be great to hear from them. My biggest concern is weight gain. I wasn't exactly slim when I started chemo and that didn't do much for my figure. Hence the user name!!
Posts.Title: Good news!!

Posts.Content: Many happy returns. Enjoy your day xx
Posts.Title: HAPPY BIRTHDAY !!!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Lins Just a thought. Maybe you've just been using the other arm much more to save the affected one and your muscles are feeling it. Carrying bags or doing housework for instance. Maybe someone else will come up with another explanation though. Glad you're feeling good otherwise x
Posts.Title: UNDERARM PAIN

Posts.Content: 5 a day? x
Posts.Title: Diet & Chocolate for nutritional purposes ;-D

Posts.Content: Hi Bev Great news! Welcome to the neddy club. xx
Posts.Title: its official

Posts.Content: Thanks for your suggestions. I wish someone would just book it and tell me where I'm going. I cant make decisions about anything. I have a head full of cotton wool. I'm going back to work on Sept 7. God help them hee hee. My daughter plays in a band who are visiting Germany next year. We might just head there but do our own thing. I went there with school when I was 13 and remember how nice it was. Not so sure about the sausages and beer tho yuk. x
Posts.Title: My wedding ring

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone for your suggestions I'm no further forward though. Probably taken a step back after yesterday. Thought I was going back to work on full pay although it's phased return. Found out the most they'll give me is half pay as I'm only doing half the hours for a while. This is because I've been off over 6 months and on half pay. They're not doing anything wrong though. It's company policy. I'm gutted as I'll be worse off with travel costs. Maybe it will be the day trip to blackpool after all. God knows how much work I'll be able to do. How long does chemo brain last? Hope you all have a good day. I'm still sitting in pjs watching old episodes of the Big Bang theory and Homes under the Hammer. Life in the fast lane xx
Posts.Title: My wedding ring

Posts.Content: Blackpool! Or I could stay home and see the local sights free Forth bridges. Soon to become 3. Maybe they'll build another and it can be the fourth Forth bridge :-) Kelpies Staying at home's fine if we get good weather. Judith, my daughter visited Northern Italy 2 years ago with her band. They stayed in a place called Piosassco. It looked beautiful xx
Posts.Title: My wedding ring

Posts.Content: I've always wanted to go to Australia but think that might be a bit ambitious. Too far and too expensive. I could maybe persuade him to go to Vegas as he's a bit of a gambler. I'd love a cruise but I'd need to do an 'A Team' and drug him like they used to do with BA Baracas. I'd love to see his face when he woke up on a ship. I can see us doing the usual couple of week in Tenerife which I wouldn't mind really but I think we have to be careful with the sun after chemo. Not much fun in a big hat and kaftan by the pool smothered in factor 50. Any suggestions? x
Posts.Title: My wedding ring

Posts.Content: Oh Judith, so many to choose from! If it's just a bar of choc, there's not much to beat good old dairy milk. I'm low maintenance lol. I also like peanut m & ms and who doesn't like maltesers although they give me toothache. Making me hungry now x
Posts.Title: Diet & Chocolate for nutritional purposes ;-D

Posts.Content: It's our silver wedding next year and my 50th. We're trying to think of somewhere different to go. Bearing in mind hubby is refusing to go on a cruise because he's scared of water and also won't go to the USA as americans are all 'nuts'. His words not mine. Could be a day trip to Blackpool then or really push the boat out and stay overnight. Maybe I'll leave him at home and go somewhere exotic on my own. x
Posts.Title: My wedding ring

Posts.Content: I started off feeling really good this morning. The sun is shining and I put a new top on which is a size smaller than I normally wear. Then I went up to my surgery to collect a prescription and try to get an appt with my GP in the next couple of weeks only to be told he has left the practice. What?? How could he do such a thing? I'm gutted!! I hardly ever saw my doc until I got diagnosed last year. Then he became like one of my best friends. Not really but I'm sure you know what I mean. Now I'm going to have to start al over again with someone else and most of the other Drs are women. I'm not keen on women Drs. Sorry a bit OTT I know. At least it's not my dentist or worst still, my hairdresser. Not that I've needed her much this year. Hope all you other moos are ok today. x
Posts.Title: Miserable Cows Club

Posts.Content: H ha. Took me about 20 mins for the penny to drop there. Can you still use chemo brain as an excuse 10 weeks down the line? Or am I just naïve? I've led a sheltered life. x
Posts.Title: stupid comments part 1!!!!!

Posts.Content: Hi there I'm finished treatment now apart from Herceptin but remember well being where you are. Waiting for results is pants and it's much better when you know what you're dealing with no matter what it is. I was lucky my surgeon took the lymph nodes through the same incision as the lump so I only had the one on my boob to contend with and the pain wasn't severe. What painkillers did they send you home with? I also had dressings which had to stay on till my follow up but they were reasonably waterproof and I was told I could shower but not immerse myself in the bath. As long as I dried myself off quickly, it was fine. Made them easier to come off too when the time came. Hope you feel better soon x
Posts.Title: Results.....waiting and sore!!!

Posts.Content: Hi I didn't have rads so can't help there. Just thought I'd add that it's heaving down here too. Just finished 3 hours hard labour at work then had to walk the 20 mins to the station. I'm sitting dripping on the train. Dry clothes and feet up for me when I get home. Luv x
Posts.Title: Quick question.

Posts.Content: Is that the one that checks your bone density? My mum was on letrozole for 5 years and was supposed to have a bone scan every 2 years and she's not had any. Obviously slipped through the net there. Think you're supposed to have them regularly when on one of the aromatase inhibitors. I'm not so I don't have to have them x
Posts.Title: Quick question.

Posts.Content: Sounds good Pat We were thinking of going away for October school holidays then I checked my passport. It expires before that. No way am I being stuck with a 10 year passport with a picture of me with my post chemo hair. Mind you it might make some of those miserable passport control people smile!! Lol x
Posts.Title: Quick question.

Posts.Content: Hi I had a bilateral mastectomy in April (after chemo) and was adamant at the time I had no interest in reconstruction. I think it's maybe easier if it's double rather than single. I would have had more of an issue with being lop sided. My mum had a single mastectomy 5 years ago and is happy just using her prosthesis. However she was 70 and said if she was my age (49) she would've had recon. She would have had to have more surgery on her existing breast to even them up and she didn't want any more ops than necessary. It is a very personal choice. Some people have a strong emotional attachment to their breasts. I didn't as I am very small but had large breasts. It's quite liberating to wear tops I never could before and get up in the morning and just pull on a t shirt. I was given amazing breast forms (Amoena) but as yet I haven't worn them as I have a lot of hard scar tissue along my ribs which makes wearing a bra uncomfortable. I haven't completely ruled out recon and am going to an info session later this year run by Breast Cancer Care so I can make an informed choice. I have heard that you get a better result with immediate recon rather than delayed but I'm no expert.  If your partner is considering recon, I'm sure her surgeon will be able to advise what the best option would be. My surgeon advised me against implants but the surgery is much longer and more complicated if they use your own tissue so it's a big decision. All the best to you both x
Posts.Title: Partner has just been diagnosed with Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Thanks Diane I'd be very interested to hear how you get on. As I have delayed my decision I'll probably have quite a long wait if I decide to go ahead so you'll be having your op long before me if I do want to have it. I think I'd also go with the stomach fat one as I'm not lacking in that lol. It is a hard decision especially as I'm finished treatment now apart from Herceptin and about to go back to work. I'm hoping this information session I'm going to will help me. Best wishes x
Posts.Title: Partner has just been diagnosed with Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Great news!! x
Posts.Title: I did it too!

Posts.Content: Me too Crystal I was grade 3 and told that was the highest. I know the stages go up to 4 though. Confusing x
